glossary.title: Glossary
glossary.description: This glossary defines key terms used throughout the AI Robotics Textbook, organized by topic area.

intro.title: Introduction to AI Robotics Textbook
intro.description: Welcome to the comprehensive guide to Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics. This textbook is designed for undergraduate CS/AI/Robotics students and covers the essential concepts needed to understand and build intelligent robotic systems.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.title: Chapter 1: ROS 2 Architecture
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.description: This chapter introduces the fundamental architecture of ROS 2 (Robot Operating System 2), the communication backbone that enables distributed robotic systems to work together seamlessly.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.title: Chapter 2: Python Integration with rclpy
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.description: This chapter focuses on implementing ROS 2 concepts using Python and the rclpy library. You'll learn how to create nodes, publish and subscribe to topics, implement services, and work with actions in Python.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.title: Chapter 3: Launch Files and Parameters
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.description: This chapter covers ROS 2 launch files and parameter management, essential tools for configuring and starting complex robotic systems with multiple nodes.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.title: Chapter 4: URDF Modeling for Humanoids
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.description: This chapter covers URDF (Unified Robot Description Format) for modeling humanoid robots. URDF is essential for defining robot kinematics, dynamics, and visual representation in ROS 2 systems.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.title: Chapter 5: Sensor-Actuator-Control Pipelines
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/chapter-.description: This chapter explores the integration of sensors, actuators, and control systems in ROS 2, forming the complete feedback loops necessary for autonomous robot operation. You'll learn how to create sensor-actuator-control pipelines that enable robots to perceive their environment, make decisions, and execute actions.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/exercise.title: ROS 2 Exercises
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/exercise.description: This collection of exercises reinforces the concepts learned in Module 1: Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2). Each exercise builds upon the previous concepts and provides hands-on practice with ROS 2 development.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/index.title: Module 1: Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/index.description: This module introduces the fundamental concepts of ROS 2 (Robot Operating System 2), which serves as the communication backbone for robotic systems. You'll learn how to design, implement, and connect different components of a robot system through ROS 2's distributed architecture.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/learning.title: Module 1 Learning Objectives
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/learning.description: This document outlines the specific learning objectives for each chapter in Module 1: Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2). These objectives provide a clear roadmap of what students should be able to accomplish after completing each section.

module-1-robotic-nervous-system/mini-pro.title: Mini-Project: ROS 2 Control Stack
module-1-robotic-nervous-system/mini-pro.description: This mini-project brings together all the concepts from Module 1 to build a complete ROS 2 control stack for a simulated humanoid robot. You'll implement a distributed system with multiple nodes that communicate to control the robot's movements.

module-2-digital-twin/index.title: Module 2: Digital Twin (Gazebo & Unity)
module-2-digital-twin/index.description: This module focuses on creating and working with digital twins - virtual representations of physical robots and their environments. You'll learn to simulate robotic systems in realistic environments before deploying to real hardware, ensuring safety and reducing development costs.

module-3-ai-robot-brain/assets/performan.title: Performance Evaluation Metrics for AI Robotics

module-3-ai-robot-brain/chapter-5.title: Chapter 5: Isaac Sim and Synthetic Data Generation

module-3-ai-robot-brain/exercises.title: Module 3: AI Robotics Exercises
module-3-ai-robot-brain/exercises.description: Exercise 1: Isaac Sim Setup and Basic Configuration

module-3-ai-robot-brain/index.title: Module 3: AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac)
module-3-ai-robot-brain/index.description: This module introduces AI-driven perception and navigation systems using NVIDIA Isaac tools. You'll learn how to implement intelligent behaviors that allow robots to perceive their environment, navigate autonomously, and learn from experience.

module-4-vla/capstone-project.title: Capstone Project: Autonomous Humanoid - Voice Command Execution

module-4-vla/chapter-8.title: Chapter 8: LLM-Based Cognitive Planning to ROS Actions

module-4-vla/index.title: Module 4: Vision-Language-Action (VLA)
module-4-vla/index.description: This capstone module integrates all previous learning into a complete system that can understand natural language commands, perceive its environment, and execute complex tasks. You'll build an autonomous humanoid robot that responds to voice commands.

references.description: This page contains important references and resources used throughout the AI Robotics Textbook.

review-workflow.title: Content Review and Verification Workflow
review-workflow.description: This document outlines the process for reviewing and verifying content in the AI Robotics Textbook to ensure accuracy, clarity, and educational effectiveness.
